channel.title: Starting server on website?
channel.description:
Hello everyone,
A friend and I would like to start a server on a website. I currently own a website (and no, this isn't some cheap Freewebs one) and he owns a MoparScape server. I was wondering if it was possible to run the Java program (and of course, all of the other files needed) on my website so it would be up 100% of the time, without him having to turn on his computer and run the server.
Is this possible? I know the batch file starts the server; would a job scheduler for UNIX be the same if I entered a UNIX command to be performed every time to run the server? Also, does MySQL have anything to do with it? I know a user asked this earlier, but he just got a response saying "MySQL," which doesn't tell me much.
Thanks.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 13, 2008, 03:28:02 PM[/size][hr]Anybody? I really think this would be an interesting project to do. Do I just upload all of the files to my website, edit a few contents in the .java files (and compile them), and then create a job scheduler to run the server?
I am sure I'm capable of doing it, I just don't know where to get started.

item.title: Starting server on website?
item.dc:creator: @JohnInteractive JohnInteractive
item.description:
@JohnInteractive wrote:

Hello everyone,

A friend and I would like to start a server on a website. I currently own a website (and no, this isn’t some cheap Freewebs one) and he owns a MoparScape server. I was wondering if it was possible to run the Java program (and of course, all of the other files needed) on my website so it would be up 100% of the time, without him having to turn on his computer and run the server.

Is this possible? I know the batch file starts the server; would a job scheduler for UNIX be the same if I entered a UNIX command to be performed every time to run the server? Also, does MySQL have anything to do with it? I know a user asked this earlier, but he just got a response saying “MySQL,” which doesn’t tell me much.

Thanks.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 13, 2008, 03:28:02 PM[/size][hr]Anybody? I really think this would be an interesting project to do. Do I just upload all of the files to my website, edit a few contents in the .java files (and compile them), and then create a job scheduler to run the server?

I am sure I’m capable of doing it, I just don’t know where to get started.
